General.name: sensitivity
General.desc: mouse sensitivity (legacy, may cause bugs if not 1, prefer input:sensitivity)

General.name: gaps_out
General.desc: gaps between windows and monitor edges

General.name: cursor_inactive_timeout
General.desc: in seconds, after how many seconds of cursor’s inactivity to hide it. Set to 0 for never.

General.name: layout
General.desc: which layout to use. (Available: dwindle, master)

General.name: no_cursor_warps
General.desc: if true, will not warp the cursor in many cases (focusing, keybinds, etc)

General.name: apply_sens_to_raw
General.desc: if on, will also apply the sensitivity to raw mouse output (e.g. sensitivity in games) NOTICE: really not recommended.

Decoration.name: blur_passes
Decoration.desc: the amount of passes to perform

Decoration.name: blur_ignore_opacity
Decoration.desc: make the blur layer ignore the opacity of the window

Decoration.name: blur_new_optimizations
Decoration.desc: whether to enable further optimizations to the blur. Recommended to leave on, as it will massively improve performance.

Decoration.name: blur_xray
Decoration.desc: if enabled, floating windows will ignore tiled windows in their blur. Only available if blur_new_optimizations is true. Will reduce overhead on floating blur significantly.

Decoration.name: shadow_render_power
Decoration.desc: (1 - 4), in what power to render the falloff (more power, the faster the falloff)

Decoration.name: shadow_ignore_window
Decoration.desc: if true, the shadow will not be rendered behind the window itself, only around it.

Decoration.name: col.shadow
Decoration.desc: shadow’s color. Alpha dictates shadow’s opacity.

Decoration.name: col.shadow_inactive
Decoration.desc: inactive shadow color. (if not set, will fall back to col.shadow)

Decoration.name: dim_strength
Decoration.desc: how much inactive windows should be dimmed, 0.0 - 1.0

Decoration.name: screen_shader
Decoration.desc: a path to a custom shader to be applied at the end of rendering. See examples/screenShader.frag for an example.

Input.name: kb_model
Input.desc: Appropriate XKB keymap parameter. See the note below.

Input.name: kb_file
Input.desc: If you prefer, you can use a path to your custom .xkb file.

Input.name: repeat_rate
Input.desc: The repeat rate for held-down keys, in repeats per second.

Input.name: repeat_delay
Input.desc: Delay before a held-down key is repeated, in milliseconds.

Input.name: sensitivity
Input.desc: Sets the mouse input sensitivity. Value will be clamped to the range -1.0 to 1.0. libinput#pointer-acceleration

Input.name: accel_profile
Input.desc: Sets the cursor acceleration profile. Can be one of adaptive, flat. Leave empty to use libinput’s default mode for your input device. libinput#pointer-acceleration

Input.name: force_no_accel
Input.desc: Force no cursor acceleration. This bypasses most of your pointer settings to get as raw of a signal as possible. Enabling this is not recommended due to potential cursor desynchronization.

Input.name: scroll_method
Input.desc: Sets the scroll method. Can be one of 2fg (2 fingers), edge, on_button_down, no_scroll. libinput#scrolling

Input.name: scroll_button
Input.desc: Sets the scroll button. Has to be an int, cannot be a string. Check wev if you have any doubts regarding the ID. 0 means default.

Input.name: natural_scroll
Input.desc: Inverts scrolling direction. When enabled, scrolling moves content directly instead of manipulating a scrollbar.

Input.name: follow_mouse
Input.desc: (0/1/2/3) Specify if and how cursor movement should affect window focus. See the note below.

Input.name: float_switch_override_focus
Input.desc: If enabled (1 or 2), focus will change to the window under the cursor when changing from tiled-to-floating and vice versa. If 2, focus will also follow mouse on float-to-float switches.

Gestures.name: workspace_swipe_fingers
Gestures.desc: how many fingers for the gesture

Gestures.name: workspace_swipe_distance
Gestures.desc: in px, the distance of the gesture

Gestures.name: workspace_swipe_min_speed_to_force
Gestures.desc: minimum speed in px per timepoint to force the change ignoring cancel_ratio. Setting to 0 will disable this mechanic.

Gestures.name: workspace_swipe_cancel_ratio
Gestures.desc: (0.0 - 1.0) how much the swipe has to proceed in order to commence it. (0.7 -> if > 0.7 * distance, switch, if less, revert)

Gestures.name: workspace_swipe_create_new
Gestures.desc: whether a swipe right on the last workspace should create a new one.

Gestures.name: workspace_swipe_forever
Gestures.desc: if enabled, swiping will not clamp at the neighboring workspaces but continue to the further ones.

Misc.name: disable_splash_rendering
Misc.desc: disables the hyprland splash rendering. (requires a monitor reload to take effect)

Misc.name: no_vfr
Misc.desc: disables VFR (variable frame rate) - VFR increases battery life at the expense of possible issues on a few monitors.

Misc.name: mouse_move_enables_dpms
Misc.desc: If DPMS is set to off, wake up the monitors if the mouse moves.

Misc.name: always_follow_on_dnd
Misc.desc: Will make mouse focus follow the mouse when drag and dropping. Recommended to leave it enabled, especially for people using focus follows mouse at 0.

Misc.name: layers_hog_keyboard_focus
Misc.desc: If true, will make keyboard-interactive layers keep their focus on mouse move (e.g. wofi, bemenu)

Misc.name: animate_manual_resizes
Misc.desc: If true, will animate manual window resizes/moves

Misc.name: disable_autoreload
Misc.desc: If true, the config will not reload automatically on save, and instead needs to be reloaded with hyprctl reload. Might save on battery.

Misc.name: swallow_regex
Misc.desc: The class regex to be used for windows that should be swallowed (usually, a terminal)

Misc.name: focus_on_activate
Misc.desc: Whether Hyprland should focus an app that requests to be focused (an activate request)

Misc.name: no_direct_scanout
Misc.desc: Disables direct scanout. Direct scanout attempts to reduce lag when there is only one fullscreen application on a screen (e.g. game)

Binds.name: pass_mouse_when_bound
Binds.desc: if disabled, will not pass the mouse events to apps / dragging windows around if a keybind has been triggered.

Binds.name: scroll_event_delay
Binds.desc: in ms, how many ms to wait after a scroll event to allow to pass another one for the binds.

Binds.name: workspace_back_and_forth
Binds.desc: If enabled, an attempt to switch to the currently focused workspace will instead switch to the previous workspace. Akin to i3’s auto_back_and_forth.

Binds.name: allow_workspace_cycles
Binds.desc: If enabled, workspaces don’t forget their previous workspace, so cycles can be created by switching to the first workspace in a sequence, then endlessly going to the previous workspace.
